perturbation.original_text: ii. Payment  to CSA no later than thirty (30) days after receipt of invoice from CSA. CSA shall submit  invoice to the Company no later than thirty (30) days after Company provides CSA with the list of the sales of Product (containing the Property with such supporting information that may be required or requested to be disclosed).
perturbation.changed_text: ii. Payment  to CSA no later than fifteen (15) days after receipt of invoice from CSA. CSA shall submit  invoice to the Company no later than sixty (60) days after Company provides CSA with the list of the sales of Product (containing the Property with such supporting information that may be required or requested to be disclosed).
perturbation.explanation: The payment deadline is changed from 30 days to 15 days, while the invoice submission deadline is changed from 30 days to 60 days. This creates a contradiction regarding the expected payment timeframe, causing uncertainty about the enforcement of payment terms.

perturbation.original_text: The period of license granted shall be for the Term and shall extend for a period of twenty four (24) months or until terminated as per clause 8 herein. It is agreed that the Term may be extended upon mutual agreement between the parties.
perturbation.changed_text: The period of license granted shall be for the Term and shall extend for a period of twelve (12) months or until terminated as per clause 8 herein. It is agreed that the Term cannot be extended under any circumstances.
perturbation.explanation: The license extension period is changed from 24 months to 12 months, and mutual agreement is disallowed making two conflicting statements about the term of the license.

perturbation.original_text: Talent agrees that Company shall, for a period of nine (9) months (Sell-Off Period) following the effective date of termination, have the right to continue to sell Product bearing  the Property and/or utilize advertising materials and collateral bearing the Property. Such sales and use shall be made subject to all the provisions of this Agreement and in particular clause 4 hereof.
perturbation.changed_text: Talent agrees that Company shall, for a period of three (3) months (Sell-Off Period) following the effective date of termination, have the right to continue to sell Product bearing  the Property and/or utilize advertising materials and collateral bearing the Property. Such sales and use shall be made subject to all the provisions of this Agreement, except clause 4 hereof.
perturbation.explanation: The sell-off period is changed from 9 months to 3 months, and the exception of clause 4 (compensation) creates a contradiction regarding what terms are applicable during this sell-off period.
